verses.text: 在下午三點禱告的時辰，彼得和約翰上聖殿去。

words.note: Verb-object compound, lit. 'report prayer'.
More formal/literary than '時間'.
Lit. 'holy hall'.

verses.text: 有一個生來瘸腿的人被人抬來。他們天天把他放在那名叫美門的殿門口，讓他好向進殿的人討飯。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb, indicating disposal or action.
A gate of the Jerusalem Temple.
Here '好' functions as a purpose or result adverb.

verses.text: 他看見彼得和約翰將要進殿，就向他們討飯。
彼得和約翰定睛看著他，彼得說：「你看我們！」

words.note: Lit. 'fix eye'.

verses.text: 那人就留意看著他們，希望從他們得些甚麼。
彼得卻說：「金銀我都沒有，只把我有的給你：我奉拿撒勒人耶穌基督的名，吩咐你行走！」

words.definition: to act in the name of

words.note: Formal verb, often used for commands from authority.

verses.text: 於是拉著他的右手，扶他起來；他的腳和踝骨立刻強壯有力，
他一跳就站了起來，並且行走。他連走帶跳，讚美 神，同他們進入殿中。

words.note: Used in the '一...就...' structure.
Used in the '一...就...' structure.
Used in the '連...帶...' structure.
Used in the '連...帶...' structure.
The leading space indicates reverence for the deity.

verses.text: 群眾看見他一邊走一邊讚美 神；

words.definition: to see, to catch sight of

words.note: Used in the '一邊...一邊...' structure.
Used in the '一邊...一邊...' structure.
The leading space indicates reverence for the deity.

verses.text: 他們一認出他就是那平時坐在聖殿美門口討飯的，就因所經歷的事，滿心希奇，驚訝不已。

words.note: Used in the '一...就...' structure.
Used in the '一...就...' structure.
Often means 'that which is done' or 'what was...'

verses.text: 那人拉著彼得和約翰的時候，群眾都很驚奇，跑到他們那裡，就是所羅門廊的下面。
verses.heading: Peter Addresses the Crowd

verses.text: 彼得看見了，就對群眾說：「以色列人哪，為甚麼因這事希奇呢？為甚麼瞪著我們，好像我們是憑著自己的能力和虔誠，使這人行走呢？

words.note: Refers to the people of Israel.
Similar to '驚奇' but emphasizes wonder.

verses.text: 亞伯拉罕、以撒、雅各的 神，就是我們祖宗的 神，榮耀了他的僕人耶穌。這位耶穌，你們把他送交官府。彼拉多本來定意要放他，你們卻當著彼拉多的面拒絕他。

words.note: Capitalized when referring to the one true God.
Refers to government officials or public offices.

verses.text: 你們把那聖者義者拒絕了，反而要求給你們釋放一個殺人犯。
你們殺了那『生命的創始者』， 神卻使他從死人中復活。我們就是這件事的見證人。

words.note: Here, 'Author/Prince of Life'.
Functions as a locative suffix here: 'among the dead'.

verses.text: 是他的名──因信他的名──使你們所看見所認識的這個人強壯了。這從耶穌而來的信心，當著你們眾人面前，把他完全醫好了。

words.note: Indicates the object of the following verb.
Indicates source or origin.
Lit. 'trusting heart'.
Introduces the object of a verb.

verses.text: 弟兄們，我知道你們所作的，是出於無知，你們的官長也是這樣。

words.note: Used collectively for 'brothers' or 'fellow believers'.

verses.text: 但 神曾經藉著眾先知的口，預先宣告他所立的基督將要受害的事，就這樣應驗了。

words.note: Empty space for reverence before 'God' in some Bibles.
Lit. 'first knower'.

verses.text: 所以你們應當悔改歸正，使你們的罪得著塗抹。

words.definition: to convert, turn back to right
words.note: Often paired with 悔改 for repentance and conversion.

verses.text: 這樣，那安樂的日子，必從主面前來到，並且他必把為你們預先選定的基督差來。

words.note: Often refers to God or Jesus.
Introduces the object of a verb.

verses.text: 他必留在天上，直到萬物復興的時候，就是 神自古藉著聖先知的口所說的。

words.note: Often preceded by a space in Chinese Bibles for reverence.
Forms 'what is acted upon' phrase with verb.
Turns preceding phrase into a nominalized clause.

verses.text: 摩西曾說：『你們的主 神要從你們弟兄中間，給你們興起一位先知像我；無論他對你們說甚麼，你們都應當聽從。

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus in religious contexts.
Often preceded by a space in Chinese Bibles for reverence.

verses.text: 無論誰不聽從那位先知，必定從民中滅絕。』

words.note: Respectful measure word for people.

verses.text: 所有從撒母耳起，以及相繼興起來講話的先知，都曾經宣告這些日子。

words.note: Used after a verb to indicate purpose or direction.

verses.text: 你們是先知的子孫，也是承受 神向你們祖先所立之約的人。 神曾經對亞伯拉罕說：『地上萬族，都要因你的後裔得福。』

words.note: Often preceded by a space in Chinese Bibles for reverence.
Forms 'what is acted upon' phrase with verb.
Literary equivalent of '的', often used in fixed phrases.
Turns preceding phrase into a nominalized clause.
Often preceded by a space in Chinese Bibles for reverence.

verses.text: 神先給你們興起他的僕人，差他來祝福你們，使你們各人回轉，離開邪惡。」

words.note: Functions as a preposition here, indicating benefit or recipient.
Often used in the Bible for God raising up leaders or saviors.
Indicates purpose when placed before another verb.
Often used in religious contexts for repentance or spiritual turning.

breakdown.m: to open, to start; part of compound
